intro: Gochnatia racemosa, commonly known as the hairy false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Gochnatia racemosa is often used in traditional medicine by Indigenous Australians for its purported healing properties.
